Element.value:
from paraview import util
inInfo = self.GetExecutive().GetInputInformation(0,0) shape=inInfo.Get(vtk.vtkStreamingDemandDrivenPipeline.WHOLE_EXTENT())
util.SetOutputWholeExtent(self, shape)

# Simulates linear transport with Ej-Heat algorithm (conduction, diffusion...)
import numpy as np
# Define the conductivity of the phases: beta codePhase1 = 0 codePhase2 = 100 codePhase3 = 200 beta=np.zeros((256,),dtype=np.float) # beta is an array, beta[phase]=conductivity of a voxel beta[codePhase1] = 0 beta[codePhase2] = 0.1 beta[codePhase2] = 1
#-------Do not modify below--------- import numpy as np import VirtualMaterials as vmat pdi = self.GetInputDataObject(0,0) numpyInputImage=vmat.Utilities.Utilities.VTKImageToNumpy(pdi)
errtol = 1e-6 maxit = 100 d = 'x' numpyOutputImage,effectivePropX,_,_ = vmat.Simulation.EJHeat.EJ_heat( numpyInputImage,beta,d,errtol,maxit) d = 'y' numpyOutputImage,effectivePropY,_,_ = vmat.Simulation.EJHeat.EJ_heat( numpyInputImage,beta,d,errtol,maxit) d = 'z' numpyOutputImage,effectivePropZ,_,_ = vmat.Simulation.EJHeat.EJ_heat( numpyInputImage,beta,d,errtol,maxit)
print('Tensor of effective property:') print(effectivePropX) print(effectivePropY) print(effectivePropZ)
#numpyOutputImage = (255.0*numpyOutputImage).astype(np.uint8) numpyOutputImage = np.zeros(numpyInputImage.shape,dtype=np.uint8)
vtkOutputImage=vmat.Utilities.Utilities.NumpyToVTKImage(numpyOutputImage.copy(order='C')) inInfo = self.GetExecutive().GetInputInformation(0,0) wholeExtent=inInfo.Get(vtk.vtkStreamingDemandDrivenPipeline.WHOLE_EXTENT()) vtkOutputImage.SetExtent(wholeExtent)
self.GetOutputDataObject(0).DeepCopy( vtkOutputImage)
